reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this location for a weekend away without the kids. The hotel is beautiful - clean and modern and the staff was wonderful. They were always present and waiting to assist us in any way. The hotel is located in a great location, just a short walk to fells point or the Inner Harbor. The staff recommended several restaurants for us to try and we decided on one in Fells Point - it was delicious and exactly what we were looking for. Our room was on the top floor and faced the harbor so we had a beautiful view. The room was spacious and my husband loved the tv in the bathroom. We can't wait for our next trip back!
reviews.title: great weekend getaway

reviews.text: Beautiful, big rooms with eye-popping views of the Baltimore Harbor. Terrific location near great restaurants (on top of their own restaurants, which are great), shopping, sights. Had a few minor glitches like I came in for dinner and they had no record of the reservation I had made via phone earlier that day; I ordered a vegetable omelette for breakfast and it came with ham; and upon checkout I asked for my bill to be emailed to me and they never sent it, so I had to call and ask. Those two things I think are uncharacteristic of Four Seasons in general, so I think they may just be working out minor service glitches of being pretty new.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities but still working out small glitches

reviews.text: I really love this hotel. There isn't much to say about it that hasn't been said in other reviews. Fantastic location, fantastic rooms, fantastic staff. Check in was fast and easy, they were even able to accommodate us when we arrived early. We chose to self park instead of valet which was easy and convenient since valet was almost $60 for one night but it's to be expected coming from such an upscale hotel. I will definitely be returning to the Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Amazing as always!
reviews.text: Best hotel in Baltimore by far! When we checked in, the room was not quite ready so we went for lunch in Wit and Wisdom. Food was fantastic! Ended up eating there for dinner 2 more nights. Crabcakes were outstanding. Wines by the glass were nice with a good selection and decent pricing.

After lunch our room was ready. The front desk told me they had upgraded us. I thanked them but didn't think much about it, thinking maybe we just had a better water view. Turned out they put us in a suite fit for a king!! It was our anniversary/husband birthday weekend and they may have remembered because I threw him a big party there last year right after they opened. Anyway, it was great and we had a wonderful time. Staff is always friendly, helpful and professional. No one does customer service better than the Four Seasons and this property is a shining example of that commitment to excellence!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Baltimore

reviews.text: Comfortable king beds, beautifully appointed rooms, and conveniently located. Great views if you have a harbor side room (if you don't, be mindful of your shades being drawn as you're incredibly close to corporate office windows), and often balconies are available. Dining in the Four Season's restaurants is recommended over in-room dining. Very much enjoy use of the Nespresso espresso machines in each room with complimentary espresso capsules. Bathrooms are a retreat unto themselves; amazing soaking tub.
reviews.title: Modern, clean, luxurious, accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay and our dog was treated like royalty. The rooms were beautiful, clean and quiet. Great location. The staff always greeted us by name and made sure our needs were met. The restaurant is also lovely and the food is excellent.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment the doorman greeted us to the moment we departed, we were treated like royalty. The shower and toiletries, superb - and not a speck of dirt, mold or mildew anywhere and I am a bit of a nut about things like that. The closet was perfect as was the rest of the room. Comfortable, modern decor without a hint of stuffiness. Panoramic views of the harbor from the floor-to-ceiling windows added to the experience. The location could not be better if your interest is dining out (or in) as there are several excellent restaurants within a few blocks.
reviews.title: Impeccably clean and well appointed room.

reviews.text: I think the title says it all... from personally hosting events at the hotel or enjoying a relaxing overnight, the hotel's quality and service is the best around. We hosted a 300+ person event last October at the hotel and the reviews about the facility were excellent. The cocktail party area (view) is one of the best in Baltimore.
reviews.title: Exceptional Stay, Exceptional Location, Exceptional Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our hotel stays, the rooms are outstanding, bed comfortable, service terrific... and even more the hotel's location is right in the middle of Harbor East area - which is great for dinner, drinks, etc. The hotel bar is known for the best hot spot around.
reviews.title: Deserving of all the glowing reviews

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times while traveling for work and the quality and service is consistent. They deliver on what you'd expect for this caliber of hotel and go out of their way to personally greet you and make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and beds incredibly comfortable. Bathroom has a great rain shower and even a tv built into the mirror (cool feature!). I prefer the rooms with the balcony so you can make a up of coffee in the morning and watch the activities of the inner harbor before you start your day. The rooms on the end of the hotel, while have an excellent view because of the floor to ceiling are glass, are smaller and not as comfortable so ask for a room not located on the corner of a floor.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here three times now and it is always consistently great. The service is spot on and the hotel is very clean. This is definitely the best hotel in Baltimore, would not stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Expectations too high?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe I expected too much. While in the main we enjoyed our three-night stay at the Four Seasons in Baltimore, the experience left me with more questions than answers. A Baltimore native who left for stints in NY & LA then returned for another 8 years (and then left again), I have a deep love for the city. Our curiosity about the “new” (relatively speaking) Inner Harbor East, plus our love for really good hotels, led us to the Four Seasons, which indeed is located in this quite newly-created, and quite prosperous, part of the city.
reviews.title: Heaven in the Inner Harbor!

reviews.text: Strictly speaking, we travel a lot internationally and tend to stay with chains like Sofitel, Park Hyatt, Banyan Tree, and Fairmount. We’ve stayed one other time at a Four Seasons (in Philadelphia) and came out of it feeling kind of beige. Bottom line this time: Super-beige.
reviews.title: Royalty !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I plan weekend getaways for each other's birthdays annually and this year -due to work schedules- we opted for just a one night stay in a luxury hotel. I had a business dinner at the Four Seasons' Wit and Wisdom this past winter and decided a nice room and meal would be a pleasant and relaxing evening for us both. I booked a king balcony room with a partial waterview for a Thursday night stay; the rate was just over $400 with the tax. And made the dinner reservation with a note that it was a birthday celebration.
reviews.title: birthday getaway stay at FS Baltimore

reviews.text: Due to traffic from Washington, we arrived later in the day ( after 5:30pm) than planned. We drove into the public garage and easily made our way to the beautiful lobby. We got a warm and friendly greeting from the young lady at the desk and she noted that it was a birthday celebration. The only thing that was "off" was she then offered an upgrade for an additional $100 for a larger room without the balcony. It was a quite odd as it 1) sounded like a scripted upsell and 2)implied that the room I'd already reserved was substandard--- in front a guest being gifted a hotel stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room itself was on the 6th floor facing the Legg Mason building and we did have a nice view of the harbor from the balcony. The room was a nice size, well decorated, comfortable bed and chairs, a very nice bathroom with a soaker tub and separate shower. There are really no complaints about the room other than that the balcony only had one chair. We would have needed to pull a desk chair from the room out to the balcony for both of us to sit out there and I thought this was an oversight.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!
Overall disappointing
reviews.text: Another oversight was that they had a small cupcake dessert in the room for my wife as a birthday treat. A nice gesture, but I point out that it was "small" because- again-we are a couple but the dessert was clearly a treat for one. ( also, as a side note , in previous years, and at other hotel properties, we've received both full sized desserts, a bottle of wine, and/or cheeses and fruits.) Certainly treats that are shareable and an overall enhancement to the stay would be a minimum expectation for the FS. It seemed perfunctory.

On the service side, we had an immediate need for a sewing kit and one was delivered to the room within minutes. Later in the evening, we had some leftovers from dinner and asked for ice in a small cooler. Housekeeping instead delivered a small refrigerator which we used from some other fruits and snacks we brought along. This was perfect. At dinner, we had a great host and waiter and it was a nice touch for the waitstaff to ALL sign a birthday card for my wife as well as give her a "surprise" dessert. Wit and Wisdom has an excellent menu with a variety of choices. I did not look at the wine list, but we were next to a couple doing the tasting menu and could tell that they had very knowledgeable waitstaff. The location and waterfront view are lovely and had it been a bot warmer, we would have lounged outside after the meal.
reviews.title: My every request was well received and taken care of. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!
